chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating While under Influence (2nd) and Operating with PAC .08 or More (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of Operating While under Influence (2nd) and the other charge, Operating with PAC .08 or More (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • David T. Bernier was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • David T. Bernier was found guilty of Operating While under Influence (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond applied to costs.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections.  If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Write an apology letter to Deputy Schuld preapproved by probation agent and due within 30 days of sentencing.  Defendant shall continue and successfully complete the Minnesota Teen Challenge Program he is currently enrolled in.  Probation may be transferred to the State of Minnesota.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for David T. Bernier
Current: 1619 Portland Ave South, c/o Minnesota Teen Challenge, Minneapolis, MN 55404 United States  (Effective: 04-30-2010)
Prior: 4675 Barbato Ct. E, Inver Grove Heights, MN 55077 United States

Defendant David T. Bernier in court with attorney Shawn M Mutter.  Karl J Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record by Mr. Kelz.  State moved to amend Ct. 1 to Obstruction 946.41 - granted.  DE entered a plea of NC to amended Ct. 1 and to Ct. 2 OWI 2nd.  Plea colloquy with DE.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty on both counts.  Further comments on sentence by counsel and defendant.  Pursuant to the agreement citation 09TR1506 is dismissed as well as Ct. 3 in the criminal complaint.  On Ct. 1 - the amended charge of Obstruction, the court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for one year with the following conditions: Apology letter to Deputy Schuld, preapproved by probation agent and due within 30 days of sentencing; payment of court costs; must continue and successfully complete the Teen Challenge Program he is currently enrolled in.  62 days sentence credit on this count.  Probation may be transferred to the State of MN.  On Ct. 2, OWI 2nd, the court imposed a $1,140.00 fine with court costs inclusive; 14 month DL revocation, with credit for administrative suspension; 20 days county jail with credit for 20 days, considered time served; AODA assessment and continue with Teen Challenge Program DE is currently enrolled in.  Cash bond shall be applied to fine and court costs in both counts. mg
Motion hearing on April 29, 2010 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant may leave the State of Wisconsin to go to the State of Minnesota.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license for the vehicle being operated.

Defendant David T. Bernier in court with attorney Shawn M Mutter.  Defendant David T. Bernier in custody.  Karl J Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls the case. Court modifies bond to a $1,000.00 signature with the same conditions as before. mh
to modify bond

Defendant David T. Bernier in court with attorney Shawn M Mutter.  Defendant David T. Bernier in custody.  Karl J Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Nicholas Schuld, sworn and testified.  No further witnesses by the state of defense.  Court is satisfied there is probable cause a felony was committed and bound the defendant over for trial on the felony charge.  Information filed by the court, further reading waived, and not guilty plea entered by the DE.  PTC set.  Ms. Mutter moved for reduction/modification of the bond.  Response by Mr. Kelz.  Further argument by Ms. Mutter.  Court denied the request for bond modification.  Ms. Mutter requested to call probation officer.  Court allowed this with the understanding Public Defender would reimburse Taylor County for phone call.  Message left with probation officer.  Matter can be brought back for further review. mg
